newsitem.title: USA: Novell making progress on CEO search.
newsitem.headline: Novell making progress on CEO search.

text.p: Software company Novell Inc is making progress in its search for a new chief executive officer, chairman John Young said on Wednesday.
Young, speaking on a teleconference call, said Novell expected to name the new CEO "before too long".
Some had speculated Novell would announce its selection on Wednesday when it released its first quarter earnings.
The company has been without a CEO since the last northern summer when Bob Frankenberg resigned.

President and chief operating officer Joseph Marengi said Novell this year will build new network services for "what we call the border", that will work between any network, not just Novell's, and the Internet.
Services for the so-called border will include firewall, or security services, and virtual private networks, Marengi said.
